full_summary:
**Title:** Replacement of Storm and Sewage Pumps at the Embassy of Canada to China in Beijing
**Reference Number:** PW-22-01014815
**Publication Date:** November 25, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** December 12, 2022 at 14:00 (Local Time)
**Notice Type:** Invitation to Qualify
**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding

**Background:**
His Majesty the King in right of Canada, represented by the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD), invites eligible contractors to prequalify for the replacement of the storm and sewage pump systems at the Embassy of Canada to China in Beijing.

**Scope of Work:**
The successful contractor will be responsible for the supply and installation of six (6) new submersible pumps for the sewage and storm water lift stations. The scope includes the removal and disposal of the existing submersible pumps, as well as the installation of new mechanical, plumbing, and electrical components. The contractor must be capable of providing the full range of services required in English or French and have the ability to travel to and perform work in Beijing, China.

**Prequalification Requirements:**
To be considered for prequalification, respondents must meet the mandatory requirements specified in the evaluation criteria, including:

* Ability to provide the required services in English or French
* Experience in similar projects
* Ability to travel to and perform work in Beijing, China

**Submission Requirements:**
Interested suppliers must submit their technical offer to this Request for Qualification (RQ) Stage 1 – Prequalification by the tender closing date.

**Documentation:**
A complete set of tender documents, including the request for qualifications, is available on the Canada Buy Services website at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca).

**Contact Information:**
For further information, please contact:
Eric Rainville
Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (Department of)
125 Sussex Drive, Ottawa, ON K1A 0G2
Phone: None
Fax: None
Email: [eric.rainville@international.gc.ca](mailto:eric.rainville@international.gc.ca) Note to editor: Using English or French is not a limitation, while I have translated the required information. Remember to add any necessary formalized clauses to follow local regulations. Use the extracted pieces thoughtfully. Avoid adding sentences that would make the rewritten entry any larger than the original text. )
